intro: Sphenogyne subflosculosa, commonly known as the slender-flowered sphenogyne, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered inflorescences and slender, grass-like leaves. The plant produces pale green to white flowers that bloom in early spring, often in moist, shaded habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species. Its botanical features make it an important subject for botanical research and conservation efforts.
